thread.title: Ex-Brighton and Wycombe star Paul McCarthy dead aged just 45 of suspected heart attack
thread.title_full: Ex-Brighton and Wycombe star Paul McCarthy dead aged just 45 of suspected heart attack

author: dfraser
title: Ex-Brighton and Wycombe star Paul McCarthy dead aged just 45 of suspected heart attack
text:
Footballer death shock Ex-Brighton and Wycombe star Paul McCarthy dead aged just 45 of suspected heart attack 
Former Republic of Ireland Under-21s defender passes away suddenly just five years after retiring from a 23-year career By Dave Fraser Comments FORMER Brighton and Wycombe star Paul McCarthy has died aged just 45 of suspected heart attack. 
The ex-Republic of Ireland Under-21s defender passed away suddenly in horrendous circumstances just five years after retiring. PA:Empics 1 Paul McCarthy has died of a suspected heart attack aged just 45 Dreadful news has reached me of the death of former Albion central defender Paul McCarthy at the age of 45. Suspected heart attack. #bhafc 
— Andy Naylor (@AndyNaylorArgus) February 20, 2017 Very sad news reaching us this morning that former #BHAFC , Wycombe and Oxford defender Paul McCarthy died suddenly yesterday aged just 45. pic.twitter.com/cPsSztoMH2 
— Wycombe Wanderers (@wwfcofficial) February 20, 2017

Sutton's plastic pitch should suit Arsene Wenger's side down to the ground Tree surgin' Sutton goalkeeper Ross Worner used to be a lumberjack... and now he's ready to cut Arsenal down to size Beer we go All hands to the pump as Sutton United order 6,000 extra pint glasses for visit of Arsenal SHIRT CHANGED Conor McGregor wears disgusting Dolce & Gabbana shirt on night out... and it cost him £465 FA Cup live Sutton vs Arsenal: Follow all build up as the fifth-tier minnows take on the Premier League giants in the FA Cup cat among the pigeons 'Lionel Messi masks Barca disaster' — Spanish press reacts to narrow win over minnows Leganes hot stuff Sutton's reserve keeper Wayne Shaw is famed for his 'Roly-Poly Goalie' chilli sauce... and turned down NAKED photoshoot I'M A BEERLIEVER Sutton star Jamie Collins admits he'll be off work boozing a few days if the part-timers KO Arsenal
